remarks:
If ` z ` is not free in ` ph ` , it is not free in ` [ y / x ] ph ` when ` y ` and ` z ` are distinct.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Aug-2016.) 

---

 If ` z ` is not free in ` ph ` , it is not free in ` [ y / x ] ph ` when ` y ` and ` z ` are distinct.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 11-Aug-2016.)  (Proof rewritten by Jim Kingdon, 19-Mar-2018.)
statement:
nfsb.1 $e |- F/ z ph $.
nfsb $p |- F/ z [ y / x ] ph $.
$d y z $.
